data.title: Gangster Movies
data.meta_description:
Never a big fan of the Godfather series but here is a list of my all time fav's: 

Gangster #1 (My all time fav. British flick but very hard to find. Suggestions?) Boys N' The Hood Belly American Me Colours Top Shottahz M…
data.text:
Never a big fan of the Godfather series but here is a list of my all time fav’s:

Gangster #1 (My all time fav. British flick but very hard to find. Suggestions?)

Boys N’ The Hood

Belly

American Me

Colours

Top Shottahz

Menace to Society

Snatch

Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

Boondock Saints (borderline gangster flick)

Casino

Scarface

Goodfellas

Chopper

Infernal Affairs

Jiang Hu

Anyone have any favorates?

Donnie Brasco

Pulp Fiction

The Untouchables

Carlito’s Way

Things to do in Denver When you’re Dead

True Romance

Bugsy Malone

Good list by the way Monster: Does anyone out there know if you can find Chopper(I’m guessing this is the movie about Chopper Read) in Taiwan?

I’d really like ot know if anyone can find Gangster #1. I can’t find it anywhere. They had it in a couple “Blockbusters” back in Toronto. Unfortunately I haven’t seen it since. It’s a British film. Extremely dark. Awesome. Had the actor who portray Brick Top in it as well as one of the guys from Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels as the lead role. I’d love to know where to find it. There’s one scene where he walks into a room…shots or stabs (can’t remember) a dude then proceeds to undress. When completely naked he unrolls a knife set and continues to slowly kill this dude. The camera’s perspective was of the man being killed. Chilling. Good story. Amazing. Jealousy, Rise and Fall, to eventual self destruction.

L4yer Cake. Just out on DVD. Outstanding. A new Steve McQueen, they’re calling the lead. Maybe, maybe not – they’re some pretty big boots to fill. But I can see why they say it.

Lockstock & Snatch producer turns his hand to directing. Does what Guy Ritchie wishes he’d thought of.

Watch it.

[quote=“sandman”]L4yer Cake. Just out on DVD. Outstanding. A new Steve McQueen, they’re calling the lead. Maybe, maybe not – they’re some pretty big boots to fill. But I can see why they say it.

Lockstock & Snatch producer turns his hand to directing. Does what Guy Ritchie wishes he’d thought of.

Watch it.[/quote]

Sandman, could ya give me a hand on researching where I could find Gangster # 1? You have to see this flick if you don’t have the slightest. Thanks for the recommendation.

I just felt like mentioning that my list of movies are my favorates because I have experienced similar aspects that have literally turned my stomach. So my films are alittle darker than most with the exception of Guy Ritchie’s flicks. Although they were violent they had a huge sense of ironic humor.

I like how Tarantino uses influences. The Kill Bill series was a good example. He used Bruce Lee films and various other Kung FOOEY movies as influences. You can also sense his asian methods of story telling. Plots and storylines. Symbolism.
